title: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText beeps when choosing SWT.MULTI
description: Bug 17825: ControlExampleText emits a beep sound when selecting SWT.MULTI option, which is not expected behavior.
OB: When using the SWT example ControlExample, under the Text tab, selecting the SWT.SINGLE style, and then switching back to SWT.MULTI style, a beep sound is emitted.
EB: The expected behavior is that there should be no beep sound when switching between the SWT.SINGLE and SWT.MULTI styles.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Launch the SWT example ControlExample. 2. Navigate to the Text tab. 3. Click on the Styles SWT.SINGLE. 4. Click on the Styles SWT.MULTI. Verify that a beep sound is emitted.
